alert.note: Alert for Hansford (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 25 at 9:14PM CDT until May 26 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Amarillo has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Texas... Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W affecting Hansford County. .Runoff from heavy rain over the last couple of days, as well as expected additional rain Thursday night will cause significant rise on Palo Duro Creek in Hansford County. For the Palo Duro Creek...including Spearman 6W...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO LATE TOMORROW EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Palo Duro Creek at Spearman 6W. * WHEN...From this evening to late tomorrow evening. * IMPACTS...At 12.0 feet, Moderate overbank flooding occurs. Cattle are threatened and damage to fences is possible * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 5.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 12.0 feet tomorrow evening. - Action stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Friday morning at 915 AM CDT.
